alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 5:09PM MDT until June 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cerro Pelado burn scar in... East Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches in less than 30 minutes are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Remember, debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jemez Springs and Ponderosa. This will impact Forest Service roads 266, 125 and 271. This will also impact Peralta Canyon and Paliza Canyon. Do not cross flooded roadways! FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams and ditches in the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
